title: Strictly fans vow to boycott show over Dev Griffin and Dianne Buswell's exit
text:
Get the biggest Strictly Come Dancing stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Angry Strictly Come Dancing fans are threatening to switch off following Dev Griffin and Dianne Buswell's controversial exit .

The popular pair got the boot on Sunday as they even ended up missing out on a final dance.

Some viewers were claiming they couldn't get through on the phones to save them.

The couple were knocked out of the competition after landing in the dance-off with Emma Weymouth and Aljaz Skorjanec.

Dianne was in floods of tears as they took to the dance floor and just stood there, unable to do a last dance.

(Image: BBC/Guy Levy)

(Image: DIGITAL/EROTEME.CO.UK)

Many voiced their anger at the result online with some every saying they may not tune in again.

One wrote on twitter: "Not good Strictly...we Aussies don't like when you do someone wrong. Might have to boycott the show now. Dianne and Dev were robbed!"

Another posted: "I can’t even explain how angry I am at strictly!! Dianne and Dev deserved so much better! boycott now."

One viewer vented: "Nah I'm fuming, Dev and diane should have NOT gone out, boycott strictly I say #Strictlyresults #strictly "

It didn't end there. " #Strictly absolute fix dev danced well better than Emma. boycott strictly" said another as one fan put: "Don't think I'll bother watching if clearly the best dancers go it's a joke surely everyone can see that?"

Speaking afterwards, Dev said that he was "absolutely gutted" to be out so early.

He said: "I’m not going to lie I am absolutely gutted, but learning how to dance, hanging out with Dianne and the other pros and celebs… I’ve absolutely loved it."

(Image: BBC/Guy Levy)

(Image: DIGITAL/EROTEME.CO.UK)

Dianne said: "Dev has been absolutely amazing. His work ethic is insane. I see him everywhere practising and I couldn’t have asked for a better partner.

"Thank you so much for all your time and your effort.

"This boy has so much talent, I’m really sad he won’t be able to show you guys any more of it."

*Strictly Come Dancing returns on Saturday 19th October at 6.40pm with the results show on Sunday 20th October at 7.15pm on BBC One
description: It was the most controversial moment of the series so far as Emma Weymouth and Aljaz Skorjanec survive
